caption:
This photograph captures a moment between two elderly men engaged in conversation outdoors. The first man on the left is dressed in a full black robe, suggesting he could be a clergyman, possibly a monk or a priest. He has dark-framed glasses and a serene expression whilst attentively listening or speaking to the other man.

The second man on the right is dressed in more casual attire featuring a moss green blazer, a beige shirt, and a light grey-striped tie. His expression is animated, possibly mid-conversation, suggesting an engaging discussion. He appears to be somewhat older than the first man, with more pronounced facial features and white hair.

The background indicates a lush, green, well-maintained garden with a solid brick building partially visible. This setting suggests the conversation might be taking place in a secluded, peaceful location, possibly a monastery garden or a similar tranquil setting.

The overall composition and natural outdoor lighting create a sense of warmth and calmness, enhancing the notion of a thoughtful, possibly philosophical conversation between the two individuals.
title: Father Eugene Dehner, professor of biology at Benedictine College in Atchison, Kansas, and Claude Warner talk on the grounds of the college. Warner's gRandparents heard President Lincoln speak in Atchison. Warner, an army veteran of the Spanish-American War, is well vested in the history and architecture of this eastern Kansas area.
